title: Virtual Reality-Based Surgical Simulation Training: Task-Example-Centered Problem-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and anatomical structures
context.additional_context: Conducted in a lab equipped with digital devices (VR headsets/simulation equipment).

learning_goals: Learners can perform basic surgical procedures (e.g., mastoidectomy) in a virtual reality environment with 70% or higher accuracy.
Learners can identify and explain five core surgical techniques for each stage of a procedure through task example analysis.
Learners apply countermeasure strategies to resolve three unexpected situations encountered in virtual surgical simulations through problem-solving tasks.

resources: Task Demonstration Videos and 3D Anatomical Models

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
